info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 2:50PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN UNION AND NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 249 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Raton to near Des Moines. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raton, Des Moines, Folsom, Raton Crews Airport and Capulin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 437 and 456. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 337 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.
